item.description:
Codeium, a startup developing an AI-powered tool to rival GitHub Copilot, has raised $150 million at a $1.25 billion valuation.

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Here’s why AI has a hard time spelling ‘strawberry’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Is AI going to take my job one day? I hope not. But in the meantime, I can do something that ChatGPT can’t: I can spell the word “strawberry.” Once again, some posts are circulating around social media that expose how high-powered AI text generators fail to know how to count, for example, how many […]

item.title: Flying through Sea-Tac’s hacked airport
item.dc:creator: Devin Coldewey
item.description:
Several days after the Port of Seattle announced a “possible” cyberattack on its systems, Sea-Tac Airport is still largely offline, causing chaos among travelers and acting as a standing warning against taking security lightly. Ask me how I know. The outage resulting from the recent hack has not, fortunately, caused planes to fall out of […]

item.title: The guy who sued NAR over real estate fees has co-founded a startup
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
One of the people who successfully sued the National Association of Realtors (NAR) to change real estate commissions has co-founded a new real estate startup. It all began in 2017 when Josh Sitzer and his wife listed their home for sale in Kansas City. The couple was frustrated by the fact they had to pay […]

item.title: Two Oxford PhDs are building an app to let you remix photos into memes
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Earlier this month, Google released a new feature with the Pixel 9 series phone to let users add the photographer in the group photo by swapping someone out and taking another photo. A new social network by a duo of Oxford PhDs is working on an app to let you add friends to a photo […]

item.title: Meta now allows preteens to explore Horizon Worlds with parent’s permission
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Meta is now letting preteens with parent-managed accounts explore different experiences in its online virtual reality (VR) platform, Horizon Worlds, with certain restrictions in place. The company announced that parents will soon be able to approve age-appropriate worlds they’d like their preteens (aged 10 to 12) to experience, including hanging out in The Space Station, […]

item.title: IBM Cloud to offer Intel’s Gaudi 3 AI chips next year

Intel has found its first -- and perhaps only -- cloud customer for its Gaudi 3 AI accelerator chips: IBM Cloud.

item.title: Russian government hackers found using exploits made by spyware companies NSO and Intellexa

item.description:

item.title: Social network Butterflies AI adds a feature that turns you into an AI character
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Butterflies AI, the new social network where humans and AIs interact with each other, is launching a new Clones feature that turns you into an AI character. This latest addition builds on a feature launched to the public back in June that lets users create AI personas, called Butterflies, that automatically create posts on the […]

item.title: UK’s Wayve secures strategic investment from Uber to further develop self-driving tech
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber is making a strategic investment into Wayve as an extension of the U.K.-born startup’s previously announced $1.05 billion Series C round. The partnership will also see the two companies work with automakers to integrate Wayve’s AI into consumer vehicles that will one day operate on the ride-hail giant’s platform. The tie-up comes a week […]

item.title: France formally charges Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, over organized crime on messaging app
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
After spending four days in police custody, the founder and CEO of messaging app Telegram, Pavel Durov, was put under formal investigation in France on Thursday for a wide range of criminal charges. He was released from custody on the condition that he does not leave French territory during the investigation. Bail was set at […]

item.description:
Reliance Industries, India's largest company by market capitalization, is not sitting out the AI frenzy that has gripped the tech world.

item.title: NEA quietly reenters the secondaries market
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
New Enterprise Associates (NEA) is getting back into the secondaries game.  The Silicon Valley-based VC raised more than $468 million for NEA Secondary Opportunity Fund, according to an SEC filing. The fundraise closed on July 3, according to a source familiar with the matter, but hasn’t received much attention. The fund raised capital from more […]

item.title: One of Bolt’s proposed new backers, The London Fund, has been scrubbing its web page
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
One-click checkout tech company Bolt is still waiting to find out if shareholders will sign off on a proposed funding round with stipulations that founder Ryan Breslow would return as CEO. In the meantime, Axios’ Dan Primack did some digging around on The London Fund, a firm that is supposed to provide up to $250 million in “marketing credits” […]

Whatever size the tranche ends up being it'll be OpenAI's biggest outside infusion of capital since January 2023.

item.title: Reddit back online after a software update took it down
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Reddit’s mobile and web applications went down on Wednesday afternoon, with more than 150,000 users reporting outages on Downdetector as of 1:30 p.m. in San Francisco. When trying to access Reddit’s homepage, users were met with the message, “Server error. Try again later.” The company itself reported a “degraded status” for Reddit.com as of 1:16 […]
